Of the Coming of the Elves
Of the Return of the Noldor
The Tale of Years (The War of the Jewels)

wikitext.*:
{{Main|Timeline}} The [[First Age]] begins with the [[Awakening of the Elves]] in the [[Years of the Trees|Year of the Trees]] {{YT|1050|n}},{{LE|131}}: "''… First Age, from the coming of the Eldar to its end with overthrow of Morgoth-melkor, the first Dark Lord.''" but those Years end in {{YT|1500}} with the creation of the [[Moon]] and [[Sun]] and were replaced by the [[Years of the Sun]]. Thus the most part of the First Age equates to c. 4,312 solar years before the first rising of the Sun.One [[Year of the Trees]] is equal to 9.582 solar years. ==[[Years of the Trees]]== {{Main|Timeline/Years of the Trees}} {|class="wikitable" |- ! '''{{YT}}''' !! '''Event''' |- | [[Year of the Trees 1050|1050]] || [[Varda]] forms the [[Valacirca]].{{AA}}§36 '''The first 144 [[Elves]] ([[Minyar]], [[Tatyar]], and [[Nelyar]]){{WJ|Quendi}}, p. 380 awake in [[Cuiviénen]].§37 The [[First Age]] begins.'''
[[Melian]] travels to [[Beleriand]] after ascending [[Taniquetil]] to see the stars.§40 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1080|1080]] || Spies of Melkor discover the Elves and afflict them.{{GA}}§4 It is possible through the torture of Melkor that [[Orcs]] are first created.§45 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1085|1085]] || [[Oromë]] discovers the [[Elves]], and calls them the [[Eldar]].§§41–2 The Eldar are afraid of Oromë and blame him for [[Morgoth|Melkor]]'s work.§§43–4 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1086|1086]] || [[Oromë]] returns to [[Valinor]] and witnesses to his peers about the Children of Ilúvatar, then returns to the [[Elves]] while the Valar consider his message.§46 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1090|1090]] || The [[Valar]] make war on [[Morgoth|Melkor]] in the [[Battle of the Powers]].§§47–8 The shores of Beleriand are formed and bays are created on the North.§6 Over the next two years, Melkor is defeated and retreats into [[Utumno]].§48 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1092|1092]] || The siege of Utumno begins. The earth is shaken; the North is desolated and the Sea widened.§49 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1099|1099]] || The [[Battle of the Powers]] ends as the Valar storm the final defences of [[Utumno]]. [[Tulkas]] captures [[Morgoth|Melkor]] and binds him with [[Angainor]].§50
[[Sauron]] evades capture.{{Cite DTP|S QS}}{{Cite DTP|S QS.03}} |- | [[Year of the Trees 1100|1100]] || [[Morgoth|Melkor]] is brought back to Valinor, judged and cast into the [[Halls of Mandos]] for three Ages of the Valar (300 Valian Years).§§51–2 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1101|1101]] || The [[Valar]] make council about the protection of the [[Children of Ilúvatar]] and decide to bring them to Valinor. Oromë extends this invitation to the Elves.§53 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1102|1102]] || The Elves are unwilling to leave [[Cuiviénen]]. Oromë invites three Elven ambassadors, [[Ingwë]], [[Finwë]] and [[Elwë]] to come to Valinor with the hope that they can convince their people to come as well.§§54–5 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1104|1104]] || The ambassadors return to [[Cuiviénen]] and invite the Elves to return with them to Valinor.§56 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1105|1105]] || First [[Sundering of the Elves]] at [[Cuiviénen]]. The [[Vanyar]] led by Ingwë, the [[Noldor]] led by [[Finwë]] and the [[Teleri]] led by Elwë and [[Olwë]] depart.§§57–8 The [[Avari]], led by [[Morwë]] and [[Nurwë]], stay in Cuiviénen.§57
The [[Eldar]] pass [[Sea of Helcar]] and turn west. Some are terrified by the smokes of war and go back.§58 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1115|1115]] || Second [[Sundering of the Elves]]: The [[Eldar]] host passes [[Mirkwood|Greenwood]] the Great and comes to the River [[Anduin]].§60 The Teleri wish to stay there, terrified by the [[Misty Mountains|Hithaeglir]].§61 [[Nandor|A part]] of them go south led by [[Lenwë]].§62 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1125|1125]] || The [[Vanyar]] and [[Noldor]] enter [[Beleriand]]; the foremost of them pass [[Sirion]] and reach the shores. Oromë goes to Aman for counsel.§63 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1128|1128]] || The unwilling Teleri also come to Beleriand and dwell east of [[Gelion]].§64 Elwë often visits Finwë in the lands of the Noldor where later will be the forests of [[Neldoreth]] and [[Region]].§9 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1130|1130]] || Elwë, returning from a meeting with Finwë, meets Melian in [[Nan Elmoth]]. They fall into a trance.§65 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1132|1132]] || [[Ulmo]] brings [[Tol Eressëa|an island]] to the [[Bay of Balar]]. The Vanyar and Noldor forget their fear for the Sea and embark upon it while the Teleri stay in Beleriand to look for Elwë.§§11–2 While departing, the island breaks and leaves the [[Isle of Balar]] behind.§11
After learning of the departure of the Vanyar and Noldor, Olwë leads some Teleri to the [[Mouths of Sirion]] where they meet [[Ossë]] and [[Uinen]].§12 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1133|1133]] || The [[Vanyar]] and [[Noldor]] enter [[Aman]] and [[Valinor]] and possess [[Eldamar]].§67{{Cite DTP|S QS.05}}{{MR|P3I5}}§38 The Valar open the rift [[Calacirya]] in the Pelóri so that the [[Light of Valinor]] reaches Eldamar where the Elves may still see the stars. The Elves begin the building of the hill [[Túna]] and [[Tirion]] upon it inside Calacirya. |- | [[Year of the Trees 1140|1140]] || The [[Vanyar]] and [[Noldor]] found [[Tirion]] and [[Mindon Eldaliéva]]. Some Vanyar yearn for the Trees and move to Valinor.§68 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1142|1142]] || [[Yavanna]] gives the [[Noldor]] the [[Galathilion|White Tree]].§69 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1149|1149]] || Ulmo summons the Teleri to Aman in answer to the prayers of Finwë.§70§§13–4 However, Ossë is grieved to lose the Teleri and persuades some to stay with him in Beleriand. These are called the Falathrim, who afterwards§36 establish the havens of [[Brithombar]] and [[Eglarest]],§14 and whose lord is [[Círdan]]. [[Ossë]] teaches them shipcraft. |- | [[Year of the Trees 1150|1150]] || [[Olwë]] and the most part of the Teleri leave Beleriand on [[Tol Eressëa]]. The rest of the Teleri remain to search for Elwë and are named the [[Eglath]].§71§§13–5 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1151|1151]] || At the begging of the [[Teleri]] who heard the calls of [[Ossë]], [[Ulmo]] halts Tol Eressëa outside the [[Bay of Eldamar]].§§72–3 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1152|1152]] || [[Elwë]] and [[Melian]] awaken from their trance. [[Elwë]] becomes the King of the Elves in [[Beleriand]].§74§16 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1161|1161]] || [[Ossë]] teaches the [[Teleri]] how to build ships; they leave Tol Eressëa and come to Valinor.§75 The Teleri who reach Valinor are afterwards named the [[Falmari]].{{MR|P3I3}}, §27 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1162|1162]] || The [[Teleri]] begin building [[Alqualondë]] with the help of [[Finwë]].§76 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1165|1165]] || The last [[Vanyar]] depart from [[Tirion]] to live on western [[Taniquetil]] with the Valar.§77{{NM|P1xxii}}, p. 164 The [[Noldor]] remain in Tirion and develop stronger ties to the [[Teleri]]. |- | [[Year of the Trees 1169|1169]] || Birth of [[Fëanor]], son of [[Finwë]] and [[Míriel]].§78Note 1, p. 101
Masons of the House of Finwë discover gems while quarrying.§79
[[Rúmil (elf of Tirion)|Rúmil of Tirion]] makes the first letters (possibly the [[Sarati]]) and records songs and wisdom (possibly the [[Ainulindalë (Rúmil's work)|Ainulindalë]]).§80 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1170|1170]] || Death of [[Míriel|Míriel Serindë]]. |- | [[Year of the Trees 1172|1172]] || The [[Statute of Finwë and Míriel|Doom of Manwë]] is proclaimed. |- | [[Year of the Trees 1182|1182]] || Finwë is allowed to marry again.Note 4, p. 101{{MR|P3II2}}, pp. 206–7 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1185|1185]] || [[Finwë]] weds [[Indis]]. |- | [[Year of the Trees 1190|1190]] || Birth of [[Fingolfin]] in Aman.§81 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1200|1200]] || Second Age of the Chaining of Melkor.§17
Traditional dating of the birth of [[Lúthien]] in [[Neldoreth]]. |- | [[Year of the Trees 1230|1230]] || Birth of [[Finarfin]] in Aman.§82 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1250|1250]] || [[Fëanor]] creates the [[Tengwar]].§83
[[Dwarves]], also known as Naugrim, enter [[Beleriand]] and meet the Elves.§19 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1260|1260]] || Birth of [[Fingon]] in Aman. Last of the [[Vanyar]] leave [[Tirion]]. |- | [[Year of the Trees 1280|1280]] || [[Finarfin]] weds [[Eärwen]].§85 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1300|1300]] || Third Age of the Chaining of Melkor.§22
The births of [[Turgon]] and [[Finrod]] in Aman.Note on §85, p. 106
The [[Dwarves of Belegost]] and the [[Sindar]] begin the building of [[Menegroth]] in [[Doriath]]. The Dwarves are paid with knowledge from Melian and with many pearls, including [[Nimphelos]].§§22–4
[[Daeron]] creates the [[Cirth|Certhas Daeron]].Note on §31, p. 110 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1330|1330]] || [[Orcs]] are first seen in [[Beleriand]].§§26–7[[#Y.T. 1330|NB]] The Dwarves make weapons for the Sindar.§§28–9 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1350|1350]] || [[Denethor (Nando)|Denethor]] leads some of the [[Nandor]] west into Beleriand and befriends [[Thingol]]. They settle in [[Ossiriand]].§30
Daeron betters{{fact}} the Cirth, which are adopted by the Dwarves and made known east of the [[Blue Mountains]].§31 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1362|1362]] || Births of [[Galadriel]] in Eldamar and [[Aredhel]] in Tirion.Note on §86, p. 106 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1400|1400]] || [[Morgoth|Melkor]] is released from bondage.§§87–8 He dwells in Valimar under vigilance.§89 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1410|1410]] || [[Morgoth|Melkor]] is allowed to walk freely in Valinor, allowing him to befriend the [[Noldor]].§§89–91 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1449|1449]] || [[Fëanor]] begins constructing the [[Silmarils]].§92 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1450|1450]] || '''[[Fëanor]] completes the [[Silmarils]].§93 He puts the Light of the Trees in them and Varda hallows them.'''§§93–4
For the next forty years, Melkor begins spreading strife and urging the need for weapons.§§95–8 Fëanor expresses his desire to reject the Valar and return to Middle Earth.{{MR|P3II6}}§52c |- | [[Year of the Trees 1479|1479]] || ''Possible'' birth of [[Idril]].{{NM|P1x}}, p. 72Tolkien calculated this birthyear under a later assumptions that the Crossing of the Ice occurred entirely within Y.T. 1496, rather than ending in Y.T. 1500, and that one Valian Year equaled 144 solar years. (Had the previous chronology been left intact, he would have calculated a birthyear of Y.T. 1483.) |- | [[Year of the Trees 1490|1490]] || Finwë summons Fëanor to a council meeting, where he threatens Fingolfin with his sword.§99§52e–g The Valar then exile Fëanor to [[Formenos]] for 12 years.§53c[[#Y.T. 1490|NB]] He takes his seven sons§53d and Finwë follows him as well. |- | [[Year of the Trees 1492|1492]] || Melkor visits Fëanor in Formenos, but he repels him.§§101–3 Finwë then warns the Valar, who pursue Melkor.§§103–4 Melkor flees and finds [[Ungoliant]] in [[Avathar]].§§104–6 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1495|1495]] || Fëanor is summoned by Manwë to Taniquetil where he and Fingolfin reconcile.§§110–2 '''Ungoliant destroys the Two Trees.§113 Melkor kills Finwë in Formenos and steals the Silmarils.§122 Fëanor names him Morgoth.§123 He and his sons swear the [[Oath of Fëanor]].'''§134 '''They begin a rebellion of the Noldor against the Valar and go to Alqualondë where they [[First Kinslaying|slay the Teleri]] and steal their swanships.'''§§136–50 '''This begins the [[Flight of the Noldor]].'''{{MR|P3I7}}
Melkor and Ungoliant flee to Beleriand where Ungoliant threatens him.§§125–6 Melkor calls Balrogs to his aid and they drive Ungoliant away.§126 Melkor, now known as Morgoth, stays in [[Angband]] and raises the peaks of [[Thangorodrim]].§§127–8 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1496|1496]] || [[Mandos]] appears before the Noldor and speaks the [[Doom of Mandos]].§§151–4 Finarfin and some of his people repent and return to Valinor.§156 Finrod, son of Finarfin, becomes the leader of his father's remaining people{{fact}} and they follow Fëanor. |- | [[Year of the Trees 1497|1497]] || The [[First Battle of Beleriand]].§§36–40 Death of [[Denethor (Nando)|Denethor]].§39 Besiegement of the [[Havens of the Falas]].§40 Thingol withdraws his people and Melian sets the [[Girdle of Melian]] around Doriath. The [[Laiquendi]] become hidden and take no other king.
The Noldor arrive at the [[Helcaraxë]].§157 Fëanor and his people betray Fingolfin and sail to Beleriand.§159
They land in Drengist seven years after the First Battle of Beleriand.§41 '''Burning of the ships at [[Losgar]].§§161–2
The [[Dagor-nuin-Giliath]] ("Battle-under-Stars").§§44–5 [[Gothmog (balrog)|Gothmog]] mortally wounds Fëanor, who is rescued by his sons before dying near [[Thangorodrim]].'''§§45–6
[[Maedhros]] meets with Morgoth under a false truce and is captured.§49 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1498|1498]] || [[Maedhros]] is chained to the [[Thangorodrim]]. The Noldor fortify a great camp in [[Hithlum]],§51 likely near the north-shore of Lake Mithrim.§§58–9 |- | [[Year of the Trees 1500|1500]] || ''' The Creation of the [[Moon]] and the [[Sun]].§§168–73 The host of the [[Noldor]], led by [[Fingolfin]], finishes crossing the [[Helcaraxë]] and enters the Northern Lands.'''§173§§52–5 The [[Battle of the Lammoth]] and death of [[Argon]].{{PM|Shibboleth}}Note 38, p. 362 The Moon rises seven times, after which the Sun follows. '''The First Age continues.''' |} ==[[Years of the Sun]]== {|class="wikitable" |- ! '''{{YS}}''' !! '''Event''' |- || {{YS|1|n}} || '''The [[Moon]] first rises, followed by the [[Sun]].''' §§53–4 '''From now, the First Age is measured in the [[Years of the Sun]].'''§56
'''[[Awakening of Men]] in [[Hildórien]].'''§57
'''Despite heavy losses, [[Fingolfin]] and his followers cross the [[Helcaraxë]],'''§163 '''fight the [[Battle of the Lammoth]] where [[Argon]] is slain by [[Orcs]],''' '''pass through [[Dor Daedeloth]] and reach the gates of [[Angband]].'''§55 |- || {{YS|2|n}} || The host of [[Fingolfin]] camps beside the north of [[Lake Mithrim]], while the [[House of Fëanor]] moves across to the southern shore.
[[Morgoth]] releases poisonous vapors from [[Angband]], which darken the sky.§60 |- || {{YS|5|n}} || [[Fingon]] rescues [[Maedhros]] from [[Thangorodrim]].§61 |- || {{YS|6|n}} || [[Thingol]] grants permission for the [[House of Finarfin]] to enter [[Doriath]], and for the [[Noldor]] to occupy the [[Northlands]].§§63–4 |- || {{YS|7|n}} || The [[Noldor]] [[Council in Mithrim|hold a council]].§§65–9 [[Maedhros]] relinquishes his claim to the throne.§69 The [[Sons of Fëanor]] relocate to [[East Beleriand]].§70
[[Fingolfin]] becomes [[High King of the Noldor]] in [[Beleriand]].§§69, 72 |- || {{YS|20|n}} || The [[Mereth Aderthad|Feast of Mereth Aderthad]]. [[Mablung|Mablung of the heavy hand]] and [[Daeron]] are sent from [[Doriath]] to attend.§72 |- || {{YS|50|n}} || [[Ulmo]] grants visions of hidden places to [[Finrod]] and [[Turgon]].§74 |- || {{YS|52|n}} || [[Finrod]] discovers the [[Nulukkizdîn]]{{clarify}} and they{{who}} begin to construct [[Nargothrond]].§75p. 352{{NM|P3vii}} |- || {{YS|53|n}} || [[Turgon]] discovers the hidden valley of [[Tumladen]].§76 |- || {{YS|60|n}} || '''The [[Dagor Aglareb]] ("The Glorious Battle") is fought and the [[Siege of Angband]] begins.'''§§77–8
[[Finrod]] constructs [[Minas Tirith (Beleriand)|Minas Tirith]] (possibly before or later).§85 |- || {{YS|64|n}} || [[Turgon]] relocates his most skilled frolk from [[Nevrast]] to [[Tumladen]]. They begin to construct the city of [[Gondolin]].§89 |- || {{YS|65|n}} || Walls, towns, and harbors in [[Brithombar]] and [[Eglarest]] constructed.§90 |- || {{YS|66|n}} || [[Thingol]] learns of the [[Silmarils]] because of [[Galadriel]].§§94–7 |- || {{YS|67|n}} || [[Thingol]] learns of the [[Kinslaying at Alqualondë]].§§100–4 [[Finarfin|Finarfin's]] children are temporarily expelled from [[Doriath]].§105 Thingol forbids [[Quenya]] to be spoken in [[Beleriand]].§§106–7 |- || {{YS|102|n}} || [[Nargothrond]] completed.§108 |- || {{YS|116|n}} || [[Gondolin]] completed.§111 |- || {{YS|150|n}} || [[Caranthir|Caranthir's]] folk meet with the [[Dwarves of the Blue Mountains]].§114 |- || {{YS|155|n}} || The first [[Assaults on Hithlum|assault on Hithlum]];§115 [[Orcs]] attack from [[Lammoth]] but are defeated by [[Fingon]].{{Cite DTP|S QS.13.032}} [[Morgoth]] realises that Orcs unaided are no match for the [[Noldor]] forces. |- || {{YS|260|n}} || [[Glaurung]] is defeated in [[Ard-galen]].§116
The [[Long Peace]] begins. |- || {{YS|262|n}} || Birth of [[Bëor]].{{WJ|14}}, "The new genealogies of the Edain", "(i) The House of Beor": Beor table II, p. 231

Birth of [[Imlach]]. |- || {{YS|311|n}} || [[Finrod]] returns to [[Nargothrond]] with [[Bëor]]; [[Baran]] leads the [[House of Bëor]].Note on §13, p. 227 |- || {{YS|312|n}} || The [[Haladin]] and the [[Drúedain]] enter [[Beleriand]]. |- || {{YS|313|n}} || [[Marach]] enters [[Beleriand]].[[#Y.S. 313|NB]] |- || {{YS|315|n}} || Births of [[Haldad]]{{WJ|14}}, "The new genealogies of the Edain", "(iii) The Haladin": Haladin table, p. 237 and [[Boron]].{{WJ|14}}, "The new genealogies of the Edain"p. 230 |- || {{YS|316|n}} || Birth of [[Beldir]].
[[Aredhel]] leaves [[Gondolin]] and weds [[Eöl]].§118 |- || {{YS|317|n}} || Birth of [[Baranor (son of Baran)|Baranor]]. |- || {{YS|320|n}} || Birth of [[Maeglin]].§119 |- || {{YS|322|n}} || [[Malach]] settles in [[Hithlum]].Footnote to Malach |- || {{YS|330|n}} || Migration of the [[Edain]] from [[Estolad]] to the lands of the three [[Noldor]] kings begins.Note on §15, p. 227 |- || {{YS|336|n}} || [[Malach]] leaves [[Hithlum]]. |- || {{YS|337|n}} || Birth of [[Amlach]].
[[Malach]] weds [[Zimrahin]]. |- || {{YS|338|n}} || Birth of [[Boromir (Lord of Ladros)|Boromir]]. |- || {{YS|339|n}} || Births of [[Adanel]] and [[Belemir]]. |- || {{YS|340|n}} || Births of [[Bereg]] and [[Belegor]]. |- || {{YS|341|n}} || Births of [[Magor]], [[Haleth]], and [[Haldar]]. |- || {{YS|355|n}} || Death of [[Bëor]]. |- || {{YS|359|n}} || Birth of [[Bregor]]. |- || {{YS|361|n}} || Birth of [[Andreth]]. |- || {{YS|365|n}} || Births of [[Hathol]] and [[Beril]]. |- || {{YS|366|n}} || Birth of [[Haldan]]. |- || {{YS|369|n}} || Great council of Men. [[Bereg]] leads a thousand people southwards while [[Amlach]] enters the service of Maedhros.Note on §19, p. 227 |- || {{YS|374|n}} || Birth of [[Beren (son of Belemir)|Beren]]. |- || {{YS|375|n}} || The [[Battle of the Gelion-Ascar Stockade]].Note on §24, p. 227 Deaths of [[Haldad]] and [[Haldar]]. |- || {{YS|376|n}} || [[Haladin]] begin dwelling in [[Estolad]].Note on §27, p. 228
Death of [[Marach]]. |- || {{YS|380|n}} || Edain migrants dwelling in the lands of the three [[Noldor]] kings number in the thousands.

Aredhel is killed and Eöl is then executed. Maeglin remains in Gondolin.§120

[[Eluréd]] and [[Elurín]] are abandoned in the wintry forest to die. |- || {{YS|507|n}} || [[Elwing]] escapes Doriath, and eventually comes to the [[Havens of Sirion]] with the [[Silmaril]].In Scheme D of the Tale of Years, the events of the Second Kinslaying and arrival of Elwing and her mother in the Havens is described in an annal for "506–507". There the Second Kinslaying coincides with Yule, which occurs at midwinter and therefore on or near the turn of the year, hence Elwing's escape is placed here in 507 rather than 506.[[#Y.S. 506 and Y.S. 507|NB]] |- || {{YS|509|n}} || [[Maeglin]] is captured by [[Morgoth]] and reveals the location of [[Gondolin]] to him. |- || {{YS|510|n}} || '''The [[Fall of Gondolin]].''' [[Ulmo]] gives her the form of a white bird and she reunites with [[Eärendil]] aboard [[Vingilot]]. |- || {{YS|540|n}} || [[Morgoth]] controls all of [[Beleriand]].{{WJ|V}}: Stage A, p. 345 |- || {{YS|542|n}} || '''[[Eärendil]] and [[Elwing]] come to [[Valinor]] and rally a great host.{{fact}}''' |- || {{YS|545|n}} || The [[Host of Valinor]] lands in [[Beleriand]].{{WJ|V}}: Stage B, p. 346 The [[War of Wrath]] and destruction of Beleriand begins. |- || {{YS|587|n}} || '''The Destruction of [[Beleriand]] concludes.''' Maedhros and Maglor sieze the Silmarils. Death of Maedhros. |- || {{YS|590|n}} || '''[[Morgoth]] is thrust from [[Arda]].''' The [[Host of Valinor]] departs [[Middle-earth]], with the exception of [[Eönwë]].{{Cite DTP|S AK}} The choice of the [[Half-elven]].{{App|Numenor}}, pp. 1034–5 |} ==Discrepancies== ===Y.T. 1330=== Tolkien also considered YT 1320 for the first year of Orcs in Beleriand. ===Y.T. 1490=== In the ''Annals of Aman'' and the first phase of the Later ''Quenta Silmarillion'', his exile is written as twenty years.{{MR|P3I6}}, §53 ===Y.S. 313=== The arrival of Marach in Beleriand is given as 314 instead, in the genealogical table of the House of Hador. ===Y.S. 402=== This battle is referenced only in the Grey Annals, and not in any material written after Tolkien pushed back the arrival of Men in Beleriand to 310, which emended most of the Grey Annals' entries concerning Men prior to the Dagor Bragollach. Many features of this annal create discrepancies with later versions. Bëor participated in this battle two years after his people entered Beleriand in 400, and 18 years before the other houses of the Edain arrived in 420, while in the later chronology all the Edain had dwelled in Beleriand for at least 89 years, and Bëor would have died 47 years prior. This does not necessarily mean Tolkien did not intend to include this event in his finalized version, but if he did, there is no indication what year the event may have been moved to, or what figures may have been involved. ===Y.S. 422=== This annal creates disparities with the post-Grey Annals chronology, similarly to that for the battle in the Pass of Aglond in 402 in the previous note. In the Grey Annals, Haleth was still alive in 422, and a man. The later genealogical table of the Haladin gives Haleth's death as 420, and the Later ''Quenta Silmarillion'' describes Thingol giving Brethil to her people and Haleth living there until her death.§29 ===Y.S. 456 and Y.S. 473=== The statement that Gil-galad was sent to the Havens in 456 was written when Tolkien considered Gil-galad to be the son of Fingon. When Tolkien considered Gil-galad to be the son of Finrod Felagund instead, he made hasty notes that Gil-galad was sent away when Finrod left Nargothrond with Beren, or when Orodreth expelled Celegorm and Curufin from Nargothrond.{{WJ|15}}, pp. 242–3 In both cases Gil-galad's mother went with him. In Tolkien's "last word on the subject" where Gil-galad is Orodreth's son and Finduilas's brother, he only wrote that "Gil-galad escaped and eventually came to Sirion's Mouth".pp. 350–1 Likewise, Gil-galad is only described as traveling with Cirdan to the Isle of Balar after the Fall of the Falas in the published ''Silmarillion'' version of the relevant passage. ===Y.S. 457=== In the Grey Annals, the date 456 was originally written above the description of Minas Tirith's capture, before being struck out and the event left to stand under the 455 annal. The description of nearly two years passing in the published ''Silmarillion'' may be a recourse to chronologies preceding the writing of the Grey Annals. ===Y.S. 489=== In the ''Grey Annals'', it is [[Blodren]] who betrays the [[Gaurwaith]] rather than Mîm. There is no indication that the dating changed when Mîm was introduced to the story. ===Y.S. 502=== In the final version of ''The Tale of Years'', Húrin takes the treasure from Nargothrond to Menegroth in Y.S. 501, which based on most versions of the story would suggest Mím was slain in that year as well. However ''Wanderings of Hurin'' is explicit in Mím's death occurring in Y.S. 502, which suggests that it was also the year Húrin and his men acquired the treasure of Nargothrond, equivalent to the acquiring of the Nauglamír in the published ''Silmarillion'' version. Therefore the casting of treasure at the feet of Thingol therefore would have to occur in Y.S. 502 as well. The same version of ''The Tale of Years'' places Thingol's death in Y.S. 503, the year in which the Dwarvish invasion of Doriath occurs. In the published ''Silmarillion'', Thingol's death coincides with his quarrel with the Dwarves, which ''The Tale of Years'' places in Y.S. 502. ===Y.S. 503=== In Tolkien's versions, including the final version of ''The Tale of Years'', Melian does not return to Valinor until after the Dwarvish invasion of Doriath, either in Y.S. 503 or Y.S. 504. Mablung's death during the Dwarvish invasion of Doriath is not found in any writings other than the published ''Silmarillion''. Mablung is one of [[Dírhaval|Dírhaval's]] sources,{{WJ|II}} and Dírhaval is not known to have ever been in Doriath, only the Havens of Sirion. In ''The Tale of Years'', Curufin and Celegorm ambush the Dwarves on their return from Doriath, and the location is named the Fords of Ascar rather than Sarn Athrad. Beren is not involved in this version. Versions in which Beren is once again involved in the Battle of Sarn Athrad, namely [[Concerning ... 'The Hoard']] and [[Letter 248]], were written after ''The Tale of Years''. ===Y.S. 506 and Y.S. 507=== In the final version of the [[The Tale of Years (The War of the Jewels)|''The Tale of Years'']] from ''[[The War of the Jewels]]'',pp. 349–50 Dior's wife is named '''[[Nimloth (elf of Doriath)|Lindis]]''', survives during the [[Second Kinslaying]] and escapes to [[Ossiriand]] alongside her daughter [[Elwing]] and with the [[Nauglamír]], but later she turns her way towards the [[Mouths of Sirion|Havens of Sirion]], likely only after hearing of the gathering of [[Exiles of Gondolin|exiles]] from [[Gondolin]] at that place in {{FA|511}}. In the published ''Silmarillion'' the chapter "Of Tuor and the Fall of Gondolin" establishes that Elwing and her people had arrived at the Havens before the exiles of Gondolin. {{references|notes}}
